metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 47 axioms covering mind-body interaction, perception, bodily actions, awareness, consciousness states, and control channels
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified eventualities and defeasible reasoning

axioms.title: Mind is not a physical object
axioms.fol: (forall (m p) (if (mind m p) (not (physobj m))))
axioms.english: If m is a mind of person p, then m is not a physical object

axioms.title: Every person's mind has awareness
axioms.fol: (forall (m p) (if (and (person p)(mind m p)) (exists (a) (awareness a m))))
axioms.english: For every person p with mind m, there exists an awareness a associated with m

axioms.title: Awareness equivalence for person and mind
axioms.fol: (forall (p m a) (if (and (person p)(mind m p)) (iff (awareness a p)(awareness a m))))
axioms.english: For a person p with mind m, awareness a can be predicated of either p or m equivalently

axioms.title: Definition of mentally in (inm)
axioms.fol: (forall (x y) (if (inm x y) (exists (p) (or (focusOfAttention y p)(awareness y p)(memory y p)))))
axioms.english: If concept x is mentally in y, then y is either focus of attention, awareness, or memory for some person p

axioms.title: Focus is part of awareness
axioms.fol: (forall (x p) (if (inFocus x p) (exists (a) (and (awareness a p)(inm x a)))))
axioms.english: If concept x is in focus for person p, then x is also in p's awareness

axioms.title: Definition of concentrate
axioms.fol: (forall (e p x) (iff (concentrate' e p x) (exists (e1 e2) (and (thinkOf' e2 p x)(gen e2 e)(will' e1 p e2)(dcause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Event e of person p concentrating on x is willing oneself to think of x, which directly causes the thinking

axioms.title: Perception causes awareness
axioms.fol: (forall (e p x a) (if (and (perceive' e p x)(person p)(awareness a p)) (exists (e1) (and (inm' e1 x a)(cause e e1)))))
axioms.english: If person p perceives x in event e, then e causes x to be in p's awareness

axioms.title: Perception defeasibly causes focus
axioms.fol: (forall (e p x m a) (if (and (perceive' e p x)(person p)(etc)) (exists (e1) (and (inFocus' e1 x p)(cause e e1)))))
axioms.english: If person p perceives x, then defeasibly this causes x to be in p's focus of attention

axioms.title: Perception requires intact sense organ
axioms.fol: (forall (e p x) (if (and (perceive' e p x)(person p)) (exists (y) (and (intact' e1 y)(senseOrgan y p)(enable e1 e)))))
axioms.english: If person p perceives x, then there exists an intact sense organ y that enables the perception

axioms.title: Eyes are sense organs
axioms.fol: (forall (y p) (if (eye y p)(senseOrgan y p)))
axioms.english: If y is an eye of person p, then y is a sense organ of p

axioms.title: Ears are sense organs
axioms.fol: (forall (y p) (if (ear y p)(senseOrgan y p)))
axioms.english: If y is an ear of person p, then y is a sense organ of p

axioms.title: Tongues are sense organs
axioms.fol: (forall (y p) (if (tongue y p)(senseOrgan y p)))
axioms.english: If y is a tongue of person p, then y is a sense organ of p

axioms.title: Noses are sense organs
axioms.fol: (forall (y p) (if (nose y p)(senseOrgan y p)))
axioms.english: If y is a nose of person p, then y is a sense organ of p

axioms.title: Stimulation causes perception
axioms.fol: (forall (e x p) (if (and (stimulate' e x p)(person p)(etc)) (exists (e1) (and (perceive' e1 p x)(cause e e1)))))
axioms.english: If entity x stimulates person p, then defeasibly this causes p to perceive x

axioms.title: Definition of attendToSense
axioms.fol: (forall (e p y) (iff (attendToSense' e p y) (exists (e1 x e2 e3 e4) (and (perceive' e1 p x)(person p) (senseOrgan y p)(intact' e3 y)(enable e3 e1) (will' e2 p e4)(dcause e2 e4) (concentrate' e4 p x)(gen e4 e)))))
axioms.english: Event e of person p attending to sense organ y is concentrating on what is perceived via y, caused by willing

axioms.title: Definition of bodilyAction
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (iff (bodilyAction e p) (exists (x y z) (and (person p)(bodyPart x p)(move' e x y z)))))
axioms.english: Event e is a bodily action by person p if it is the movement of one of p's body parts from y to z

axioms.title: Definition of reflex
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (iff (reflex e p) (exists (e1 x1 y1 z1 s e2) (and (bodilyAction e p)(move' e1 x1 y1 z1) (not (at y1 p s))(bodyPart z1 p)(cause e1 e) (arg* z1 e2)(enable e2 e) (not (exists (e3) (and (will' e3 p e)(dcause e3 e))))))))
axioms.english: Event e is a reflex by person p if it's a bodily action caused by external motion to a body part, but not willed

axioms.title: Definition of tic
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (iff (tic e p) (exists (b e2) (and (bodilyAction e p)(not (reflex e p)) (body b p)(arg* b e2)(enable e2 e) (not (exists (e3) (and (will' e3 p e)(dcause e3 e))))))))
axioms.english: Event e is a tic by person p if it's an unwilled bodily action enabled by body properties but not a reflex

axioms.title: Definition of voluntaryAction
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (iff (voluntaryAction e p) (exists (e3) (and (bodilyAction e p) (will' e3 p e)(dcause e3 e)))))
axioms.english: Event e is a voluntary action by person p if it's a bodily action that is directly caused by willing

axioms.title: Voluntary actions are plan executions
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (and (voluntaryAction e p)(etc)) (exists (q) (executePlan' e p q))))
axioms.english: If e is a voluntary action by person p, then defeasibly e is an execution of some plan q by p

axioms.title: Voluntary actions serve larger plans
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (and (voluntaryAction e p)(etc)) (exists (e0 q) (execute' e p e0 q))))
axioms.english: If e is a voluntary action by person p, then defeasibly e serves some subgoal e0 of a larger plan q

axioms.title: Definition of involuntaryAction
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (iff (involuntaryAction e p) (or (reflex e p)(tic e p))))
axioms.english: Event e is an involuntary action by person p if it is either a reflex or a tic

axioms.title: Definition of controlBody
axioms.fol: (forall (p b) (iff (controlBody p b) (and (person p)(body b p) (exists (e) (voluntaryAction e p)))))
axioms.english: Person p controls body b if p has b as their body and p performs voluntary actions

axioms.title: Definition of coordinatedAction
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (iff (coordinatedAction e p) (exists (e1 e2 e3 e4 t1 t2) (and (bodilyAction e1 p)(subevent e1 e) (atTime' e3 e1 t1) (bodilyAction e2 p)(subevent e2 e) (atTime' e4 e2 t2) (causallyInvolved e3 e4)))))
axioms.english: Event e is a coordinated action by person p if it involves multiple body parts whose timing is causally related

axioms.title: Failed bodily action - willing doesn't cause movement
axioms.fol: (forall (e p e1) (if (and (will' e1 p e)(bodilyAction e p)(not (dcause e1 e))) (failedBodilyAction e p)))
axioms.english: If person p wills bodily action e but the willing doesn't directly cause e, then e is a failed bodily action

axioms.title: Failed bodily action - goal not achieved
axioms.fol: (forall (e p e1 e2) (if (and (will' e1 p e)(bodilyAction e p)(dcause e1 e) (subgoal e e2) (not (cause e e2))) (failedBodilyAction e p)))
axioms.english: If person p successfully wills bodily action e but e fails to achieve its subgoal e2, then e is failed

axioms.title: Successful bodily action
axioms.fol: (forall (e p e1 e2) (if (and (will' e1 p e)(bodilyAction e p)(dcause e1 e) (subgoal e e2)(cause e e2)) (successfulBodilyAction e p)))
axioms.english: If person p successfully wills bodily action e and e achieves its subgoal e2, then e is successful

axioms.title: Definition of fluentAction
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (iff (fluentAction e p) (exists (q) (and (voluntaryAction e p)(executePlan' e p q) (skilled e q)))))
axioms.english: Event e is a fluent action by person p if it's a skilled execution of a voluntary action plan

axioms.title: Definition of awkwardAction
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (iff (awkwardAction e p) (exists (q s s1) (and (voluntaryAction e p)(executePlan' e p q) (skillScale s q)(Lo s1 s)(inScale e s1)))))
axioms.english: Event e is an awkward action by person p if it's a voluntary action in the low region of the skill scale

axioms.title: Bodily actions defeasibly cause self-perception
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (and (bodilyAction e p)(etc)) (perceive p e)))
axioms.english: If e is a bodily action by person p, then defeasibly p perceives e

axioms.title: Voluntary actions always cause self-perception
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (voluntaryAction e p)(perceive p e)))
axioms.english: If e is a voluntary action by person p, then p perceives e (non-defeasibly)

axioms.title: Definition of senseOrganAction
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (iff (senseOrganAction e p) (exists (x y z e1 w) (and (person p)(senseOrgan x p)(move' e x y z) (or (and (enable e e1)(perceive' e1 p w)) (and (enable e e2)(not' e2 e1)))))))
axioms.english: Event e is a sense organ action by person p if it moves a sense organ to enable or prevent perception

axioms.title: Definition of tuneIn
axioms.fol: (forall (p s) (iff (tuneIn p x) (exists (e1 e2) (and (person p)(perceive p x) (will' e1 p e2)(inFocus' e2 x p)(dcause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Person p tunes in to perception x by willing x to be in focus, which directly causes it

axioms.title: Definition of tuneOut
axioms.fol: (forall (p s) (iff (tuneOut p x) (exists (e1 e2 e3) (and (person p)(perceive p x) (will' e1 p e3)(not' e3 e2)(inFocus' e2 x p) (dcause e1 e3)))))
axioms.english: Person p tunes out perception x by willing x not to be in focus, which directly causes the negation

axioms.title: Definition of impaired
axioms.fol: (forall (x) (iff (impaired x) (exists (e1 y e e2 e3) (and (functionality e1 y e x) (arg* y e2)(not' e3 e1)(cause e2 e3)))))
axioms.english: Entity x is impaired if some functionality e1 of component y is not achieved due to properties of y

axioms.title: Definition of destroyed
axioms.fol: (forall (x) (iff (destroyed x) (forall (e1 y e) (if (functionality e1 y e x) (exists (e2 e3) (and (arg* y e2)(not' e3 e1) (cause e2 e3)))))))
axioms.english: Entity x is destroyed if none of its functional components achieve their functionality

axioms.title: Body functionality is physical thriving
axioms.fol: (forall (p b e1) (if (and (person p)(body b p) (thrive' e1 p)(functionality0 e1 p)) (exists (e2) (and (thrivePhysically' e2 b) (functionality e2 b e1 p)))))
axioms.english: If person p's thriving e1 is their absolute functionality, then body b's physical thriving e2 is its relative functionality

axioms.title: Body states are exhaustive
axioms.fol: (forall (b p) (if (body b p) (or (intact b)(impaired b)(destroyed b))))
axioms.english: Every body b of person p is either intact, impaired, or destroyed

axioms.title: Body part states are exhaustive
axioms.fol: (forall (x p) (if (bodyPart x p) (or (intact x)(impaired x)(destroyed x))))
axioms.english: Every body part x of person p is either intact, impaired, or destroyed

axioms.title: Envisioning implies reasoning
axioms.fol: (forall (s p) (if (ecs s p) (reasoning p)))
axioms.english: If person p has eventuality complex structure s, then p is reasoning

axioms.title: Logical operations imply reasoning
axioms.fol: (forall (p e1 e2 e3 e4 e5 e6) (if (and (person p)(imply' e1 e2 e3)(and' e4 e2 e1) (inFocus' e5 e4 p)(inFocus' e6 e3 p)(cause e5 e6)) (reasoning p)))
axioms.english: If person p has logical premises in focus that cause the conclusion to be in focus, then p is reasoning

axioms.title: Definition of active mind
axioms.fol: (forall (p m) (if (and (person p)(mind m p)) (iff (active m) (exists (x) (and (inFocus x p)(reasoning p))))))
axioms.english: Mind m of person p is active if there are thoughts in focus and p is reasoning

axioms.title: Definition of impaired mind
axioms.fol: (forall (p m) (if (and (person p)(mind m p)) (iff (impaired m) (and (exists (x) (inFocus x p)) (not (reasoning p))))))
axioms.english: Mind m of person p is impaired if there are thoughts in focus but p is not reasoning

axioms.title: Definition of inactive mind
axioms.fol: (forall (p m) (if (and (person p)(mind m p)) (iff (inactive m) (not (exists (x) (inFocus x p))))))
axioms.english: Mind m of person p is inactive if there are no thoughts in focus

axioms.title: Mind states are exhaustive
axioms.fol: (forall (m p) (if (and (person p)(mind m p)) (xor (active m)(impaired m)(inactive m))))
axioms.english: Mind m of person p is either active, impaired, or inactive (exclusively)

axioms.title: Persons have sensation and control channels
axioms.fol: (forall (p) (if (person p) (exists (s c) (and (sensationChannel s p)(controlChannel c p)))))
axioms.english: Every person p has a sensation channel s and a control channel c

axioms.title: Definition of active sensation channel
axioms.fol: (forall (p s o e1 x s1) (if (and (person p)(sensationChannel s p)(senseOrgan o p) (near' e1 x o s1)(spatialSystem s1)) (iff (active s) (and (exists (e2) (and (perceive' e2 p x)(cause e1 e2))) (forall (y) (if (perceive p y)(Rexist y)))))))
axioms.english: Sensation channel s is active if nearby entities cause perception and all perceived things exist

axioms.title: Definition of impaired sensation channel
axioms.fol: (forall (p s) (if (and (person p)(sensationChannel s p)) (iff (impaired s) (exists (y) (and (perceive p y)(not (Rexist y)))))))
axioms.english: Sensation channel s is impaired if person p perceives things that don't actually exist

axioms.title: Definition of inactive sensation channel
axioms.fol: (forall (p s) (if (and (person p)(sensationChannel s p)) (iff (inactive s) (forall (o x s1) (if (and (senseOrgan o p)(near x o s1)(spatialSystem s1)) (not (perceive p x)))))))
axioms.english: Sensation channel s is inactive if person p fails to perceive nearby entities via sense organs

axioms.title: Sensation channel states are exhaustive
axioms.fol: (forall (s p) (if (and (person p)(sensationChannel s p)) (xor (active s)(impaired s)(inactive s))))
axioms.english: Sensation channel s is either active, impaired, or inactive (exclusively)

axioms.title: Definition of active control channel
axioms.fol: (forall (p c) (if (and (person p)(controlChannel c p)) (iff (active c) (forall (e1 e) (if (and (will' e1 p e)(voluntaryAction e p)) (cause e1 e))))))
axioms.english: Control channel c is active if willing voluntary actions always causes those actions to occur

axioms.title: Definition of impaired control channel
axioms.fol: (forall (p c) (if (and (person p)(controlChannel c p)) (iff (impaired c) (exists (e e0 e1) (and (will' e1 p e)(voluntaryAction e p) (cause e1 e0)(bodilyAction e0 p) (not (equal e0 e)))))))
axioms.english: Control channel c is impaired if willing a voluntary action causes a different bodily action than intended

axioms.title: Definition of inactive control channel
axioms.fol: (forall (p c) (if (and (person p)(controlChannel c p)) (iff (inactive c) (or (not (exists (e1 e) (will' e1 p e))) (forall (e1 e) (if (will' e1 p e) (not (exists (e0) (and (bodilyAction e0 p) (cause e1 e0))))))))))
axioms.english: Control channel c is inactive if no willing occurs or willing causes no bodily actions

axioms.title: Control channel states are exhaustive
axioms.fol: (forall (c p) (if (and (person p)(controlChannel c p)) (xor (active c)(impaired c)(inactive c))))
axioms.english: Control channel c is either active, impaired, or inactive (exclusively)

axioms.title: Definition of fine state
axioms.fol: (forall (p b m s c) (if (and (person p)(body b p)(mind m p)(sensationChannel s p) (controlChannel c p)(fine p)) (and (intact b)(active m)(active s)(active c))))
axioms.english: If person p is fine, then their body is intact and their mind and channels are active

axioms.title: Definition of unconscious state
axioms.fol: (forall (p b m s c) (if (and (person p)(body b p)(mind m p)(sensationChannel s p) (controlChannel c p)(unconscious p)) (and (intact b)(inactive m)(inactive s)(inactive c))))
axioms.english: If person p is unconscious, then their body is intact but their mind and channels are inactive

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Extensive use of primed predicates for mental and bodily actions like will', perceive', concentrate', move', attendToSense', indicating reified eventuality structures
conversion_notes.defeasible_reasoning: Uses (etc) predicate in 4 axioms for defeasible rules about perception, voluntary actions, and bodily self-perception
conversion_notes.dualist_framework: Adopts Cartesian dualist perspective with mind as non-physical entity interacting with physical body through sensation and control channels
conversion_notes.channel_theory: Novel formalization of mind-body interaction through sensation and control channels with active/impaired/inactive states
conversion_notes.consciousness_states: Systematic treatment of consciousness states like fine, unconscious with specific combinations of component states
conversion_notes.action_taxonomy: Sophisticated classification of bodily actions into voluntary, involuntary (reflex, tic), coordinated, fluent, awkward, failed, successful

file_format_notes.axiom_extraction: All 56 axioms extracted from pages 485-498 with complete FOL expressions and natural language explanations
file_format_notes.predicate_inventory: 33 new predicates introduced specifically for mind-body interaction concepts
file_format_notes.complexity_analysis: Balanced complexity distribution with moderate axioms predominating due to complex mental state definitions
file_format_notes.pattern_categorization: 16 distinct axiom patterns identified, with basic definitions and type constraints most common
file_format_notes.cross_references: Heavy integration with previous chapters on persons, memory, knowledge, goals, and planning frameworks
